2.text: I have heard many such things: miserable comforters are you all.

3.text: Shall vain words have an end? or what emboldens you that you answer?

4.text: I also could speak as you do: if your soul were in my soulâ€™s stead, I could heap up words against you, and shake my head at you.

5.text: But I would strengthen you with my mouth, and the moving of my lips should assuage your grief.

6.text: Though I speak, my grief is not assuaged: and though I forbear, what am I eased?

7.text: But now he has made me weary: you have made desolate all my company.

8.text: And you have filled me with wrinkles, which is a witness against me: and my leanness rising up in me bears witness to my face.

9.text: He tears me in his wrath, who hates me: he gnashes on me with his teeth; my enemy sharpens his eyes on me.

10.text: They have gaped on me with their mouth; they have smitten me on the cheek reproachfully; they have gathered themselves together against me.

11.text: God has delivered me to the ungodly, and turned me over into the hands of the wicked.

12.text: I was at ease, but he has broken me asunder: he has also taken me by my neck, and shaken me to pieces, and set me up for his mark.

13.text: His archers compass me round about, he splits my reins asunder, and does not spare; he pours out my gall on the ground.

14.text: He breaks me with breach on breach, he runs on me like a giant.

15.text: I have sewed sackcloth on my skin, and defiled my horn in the dust.

16.text: My face is foul with weeping, and on my eyelids is the shadow of death;

17.text: Not for any injustice in my hands: also my prayer is pure.

18.text: O earth, cover not you my blood, and let my cry have no place.

19.text: Also now, behold, my witness is in heaven, and my record is on high.

20.text: My friends scorn me: but my eye pours out tears to God.

21.text: O that one might plead for a man with God, as a man pleads for his neighbor!

22.text: When a few years are come, then I shall go the way from where I shall not return.
